intro: Chytraculia fasciculata, commonly known as the slender chytracul, is a rare aquatic plant found in freshwater habitats. It belongs to the order Spermatophyta and is characterized by its delicate, ribbon-like leaves that float on the water surface. The plant has a simple structure with a short, unbranched stem and small, inconspicuous flowers. It plays a role in maintaining water quality by absorbing nutrients and providing habitat for microorganisms. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
